user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_socket_nonblocking_:
```c
int
MHD_socket_nonblocking_ (MHD_socket sock)
{
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (sock,
                 F_GETFL);
  if (-1 == flags)
    return 0;

  if ( ((flags | O_NONBLOCK) != flags) &&
       (0 != fcntl (sock,
                    F_SETFL,
                    flags | O_NONBLOCK)) )
    return 0;
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  unsigned long flags = 1;

  if (0 != ioctlsocket (sock,
                        (int) FIONBIO,
                        &flags))
    return 0;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_socket_nonblocking_:
#define MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS 1
...
typedef int MHD_socket
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  unsigned long flags = 1;

  if (0 != ioctlsocket (sock,
                        (int) FIONBIO,
                        &flags))
    return 0;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: In the given project configuration MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS is defined, so the #elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS) block is excluded by the preprocessor and is not present in the translation unit — therefore there is no unreachable code in the compiled project. Note: a violation would occur if the build configuration defined both MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS and MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS (or otherwise made the #elif branch impossible to select in any build), because then the WINSOCK branch would be permanently unreachable in that project configuration.
